definitions.definition: To ooze or pass slowly through pores or other small openings, and in overly small quantities; said of liquids, etc.
definitions.example: The water steadily seeped in through the thirl.

definitions.definition: To enter or penetrate slowly; to spread or diffuse.
definitions.example: Fear began to seep into the local community over the contamination of their fishpond.

definitions.definition: To diminish or wane away slowly.
definitions.example: The resistance movement against the invaders had slowly  seeped away.

definitions.definition: To drink slowly, small mouthfuls at a time.
To taste the liquor of; to drink out of.
To consume slowly — in contrast to faster consumption, in contrast to zero consumption
